item.title: I Built a Rate Lock Ladder Before Choosing a Lender
item.description: I used to assume the lowest quoted rate wins. Then I watched a lender reprice three times in one week, wiping out every savings estimate I had shared with my spouse. I promised our family I would never stumble through rate shopping again. This fall, I built a rate lock ladderâ€”a structured quick-hit process that let me compare five conforming lenders, assign lock windows, and negotiate with facts instead of adrenaline. Here is how the 48-hour sprint unfolded and how you can copy it.
